net.java.jddac.common.util
Class SubscriberRegistry

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.util.SubscriberRegistry

public class SubscriberRegistry
extends java.lang.Object

Keeps track of publication topics and the Subscribers which are subscribing to those topics. This is a class used by the infrastructure and generally should not need to be modified by the application developer.

addSubscription

public void addSubscription(java.lang.String subscription_qualifier,
                            SubscriberPort port)
Associate a topic with a subscriber port.

Parameters:
subscription_qualifier - Publication topic name to listen to.
port - The instance of the port which should be notified when the publication is received.

removeSubscription

public void removeSubscription(java.lang.String subscription_qualifier,
                               SubscriberPort port)
Disassociates a topic with a subscriber port.

Parameters:
subscription_qualifier - Topic to unsubscribe from.
port -

lookupSubscriptions

public java.util.Vector lookupSubscriptions(java.lang.String subscription_qualifier)
Given a topic, returns a Vector containing ports which are subscribing to this topic.

Parameters:
subscription_qualifier -
Returns:
Vector if there are subscribers, then returns a vector containing the port instances which are subscribing to this topic. If no one is subscribing to the topic, a NULL is returned. Note NOT a vector with no entries!

getAllSubscriberPorts

public java.util.Vector getAllSubscriberPorts()
Retrieve all SubScribers known to SubscriberRegistry

Returns:
Vector Vector which contains all ports known to the registry.
